safety_precautions: Always wear safety glasses when cutting or drilling wood
Use clamps to secure the chair when working on it
Work in a well-ventilated area when applying finish
Wear gloves when handling sharp tools

steps.description: Measure the dimensions of the chair seat area.
Cut a piece of replacement wood to the measured size.
Smooth the edges of the cut wood with sandpaper.
Position the new seat on the chair frame and secure with clamps.
Drill pilot holes through the chair frame into the new seat.
Use the screwdriver to secure the new seat to the chair frame with wood screws.
Apply wood glue around the edges for extra strength.
Once the glue is dry, apply the finish to match the rest of the chair.

tips: Ensure the replacement wood is of the same type and thickness as the original seat
Pre-drill holes to prevent splitting the wood
Allow the finish to dry completely before using the chair
